intro: Prunus domestica var. mamillaris, commonly known as the mamillaris plum, is a cultivar of the common European plum. It is characterized by its small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color when ripe. The plant is a deciduous shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3–5 meters. Its leaves are ovate with a serrated margin and a dark green upper surface. The flowers are usually pink or white, appearing in clusters, and the fruit ripens in late summer to early autumn.
